required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Rectal Washout in Transanal Total Mesorectal Excision and Presence of Intraluminal Malignant Cells
clinical_study.official_title: Rectal Washout in Transanal Total Mesorectal Excision and Presence of Intraluminal Malignant Cells

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to assess the existence of intraluminal malignant cells and the appropriate fluid volume needed to perform rectal washout during transanal total mesorectal excision (taTME) for rectal cancer.

detailed_description.textblock: Twenty patients undergoing taTME for rectal cancer is included. Following the closure of the rectal lumen by a purse string suture, rectal washout is performed with a total of 500 ml sterile water. Fluid samples are collected after every 100 ml by instilling 50 ml of saline after each washout. A sixth sample is collected from the presacral cavity. Each sample is cytologically examined by a pathologist and labelled either malignant or non-malignant.

primary_outcome.measure: Existence of intraluminal malignant cells in fluid samples from rectal washout

secondary_outcome.measure: Fluid volume needed to perform rectal washout during transanal total mesorectal excision to eliminate intraluminal malignant cells

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients undergoing rectal washout in transanal mesorectal excision
arm_group.description: Patients undergoing rectal washout in transanal mesorectal excision for rectal cancer.

intervention.description: Rectal washout is performed intraoperatively before transection and means irrigation of the rectum following the closure of the rectal lumen below the tumour with a purse string suture. Rectal washout is performed with a total of 500 ml sterile water. Fluid samples are collected after every 100 ml by instilling 50 ml of saline after each washout. A sixth sample is collected from the presacral cavity.
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients undergoing rectal washout in transanal mesorectal excision

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing transanal mesorectal excision at Slagelse Hospital, Denmark

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Surgery at Slagelse Hospital for rectal cancer with transanal mesorectal excision
- Consent to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- No consent to participate
- No surgery

overall_official.affiliation: Skåne University Hospital, Malmö, Region Skåne, Sweden
